meanings.definition: To cause the destruction of something
meanings.sent1: The storm wrecked the old barn.
meanings.sent2: The car wrecked the fence when it crashed into it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy wrecked the garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions wrecked her trust in him.
meanings.sent5: The tornado wrecked havoc on the small town, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of ruin or destruction
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house looked wrecked and abandoned.
meanings.sent2: After the earthquake, the city was left wrecked and in need of repair.
meanings.sent3: The cake was wrecked when the cat jumped on the table and knocked it over.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt wrecked after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The old shipwrecked on the shore looked truly wrecked, with its hull cracked and splintered.
